means: 使困难，使为难( baffle的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Medical authorities were baffled, both as to its causes and its virulence.
sentence.Network_cn: 医疗当局对其病因及有多致命都还不甚了解。

sentence.Network_en: I confess it's got me baffled.
The question baffled me completely and I couldn't answer it.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个问题把我彻底难倒了,我答不出来.

entry.def: If something baffles you, you cannot understand it or explain it.

example.ex: An apple tree producing square fruit is baffling experts.
example.tran: 一棵结方形苹果的树令专家大惑不解。

means.word_mean: 1. people who are frustrated and perplexed;

sentences.sentence: "the children's faces clearly expressed the frustration of the baffled"

means.word_mean: 1. perplexed by many conflicting situations or statements; filled with bewilderment;

sentences.sentence: "she felt lost on the first day of school"

auth_sentence.content: His latest remarks seem to have baffled political watchers.
auth_sentence.res_content: His latest remarks seem to have baffled political watchers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His latest remarks seem to have baffled political watchers.

auth_sentence.content: Liberals in the west look on baffled and horrified.
auth_sentence.res_content: Liberals in the west look on baffled and horrified.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Liberals in the west look on baffled and horrified.

auth_sentence.content: Yet he is still baffled as to the cause.
auth_sentence.res_content: Yet he is still baffled as to the cause.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Yet he is still baffled as to the cause.

Sentence.sentence: An investigation found that many of the super-rich were baffled by the infinite choices their money made available.
